title: Matplotlib Introduction
subject: Data Science
theory: Matplotlib is the grandfather of Python plotting. It provides fine-grained control over every pixel. The `pyplot` module states-machine approach is common for quick plots.
syntax:
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
plt.plot(x, y)
plt.show()

examples.code:
x = [1, 2, 3]
y = [10, 20, 15]
plt.plot(x, y, color='red', marker='o')
plt.title('Sales')
plt.show()

common_mistakes.correction: In scripts, the plot won't appear without show(). In Jupyter, `%matplotlib inline` handles it.

summary: Matplotlib is powerful but verbose. It underlies many other libraries.
